resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
wesm commented on pull request #4537: ARROW-5531: [Python] Implement Array.from_buffers for varbinary and nested types, add DataType.num_buffers property
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4537
 
 
   Thanks to Antoine's recent work on `Array::View` this method can be made more robust and safe by checking for the correct number of buffers.

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4537#discussion_r293416297
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/array.pxi
 ##########
 @@ -561,9 +561,10 @@ cdef class Array(_PandasConvertible):
             (_reduce_array_data(self.sp_array.get().data().get()),)
 
     @staticmethod
-    def from_buffers(DataType type, length, buffers, null_count=-1, offset=0):
+    def from_buffers(DataType type, length, buffers, null_count=-1, offset=0,
+                     children=None):
         """
-        Construct an Array from a sequence of buffers.  The concrete type
+        Construct an Array from a sequence of buffers. The concrete type
         returned depends on the datatype.
 
         Parameters
 
 Review comment:
   Should document the _children_ argument below.

pitrou commented on pull request #4537: ARROW-5531: [Python] Implement Array.from_buffers for varbinary and nested types, add DataType.num_buffers property
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4537#discussion_r293417589
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/tests/test_array.py
 ##########
 @@ -310,8 +310,81 @@ def test_array_from_buffers():
     with pytest.raises(TypeError):
         pa.Array.from_buffers(pa.int16(), 3, [u'', u''], offset=1)
 
-    with pytest.raises(NotImplementedError):
-        pa.Array.from_buffers(pa.list_(pa.int16()), 4, [None, values_buf])
+
+def test_string_binary_from_buffers():
+    array = pa.array(["a", None, "b", "c"])
+
+    buffers = array.buffers()
+    copied = pa.StringArray.from_buffers(
 
 Review comment:
   Ah, I hadn't noticed that `StringArray` had a different `from_buffers` method.

fields.summary: [Python] Support binary, utf8, and nested types in Array.from_buffers
